comment: Professor Conrey has been the best teacher I have had yet at KSU. He is clear one what he wants and does not just give you an understanding of how to do things in SolidWorks but also how the system functions as a whole. Always there to help and answer questions. Definitely taking him again as many times as I can for any class I need.
Great Professor, you will not regret taking Graphics with him. He's an active industry professional and is very detail oriented
Avoid for graphics at all costs!!
He is a great professor and passionate about Graphics.  I would recommend him to anyone that is prepared to work.

Pretty straight forward to class. The grades are easy to get if you do the work. You will need to actually read for his quizzes. If you're not too savvy with basic computer skills this EDG classes may not be for you. Great guy!

He has high expectations (read: grades hard)and gives a lot of assignments, but is also very helpful and makes himself available to students.  Do ALL the assignments and you will be fine (a single zero will kill you, despite the 20 or 30 assignments).  If he says to read the chapter, READ THE CHAPTER.

Take him for any graphics course! He is a great professor, and knows his stuff. Knows SolidWorks like a champ. He will make you work for your grade for sure. He grades stern, but fair. You will learn SolidWorks. However, I am not sure how I got a B in his course, but refuse to call him a liar so I trust my grade. Final project is what you hear.

A master at drafting and teaching it to others.  Took him for 1211 and 1212 and before this class I considered myself '3D challenged' and dreaded taking these.  Conrey made it enjoyable and he genuinely cares about his students' success.  If you work hard, make an effort to try the work, and put in the hours on the final project, you will be fine.

Best Graphics Professor ever. I had an AAS in Drafting prior to this class and I learned enormously from him. Take him for EDGR I & II don't take anyone else, they aren't even close. You will learn a lot about Solidworks and Drafting Standards. I've gotten a drafting/engineering Internship based on what I learned in this class + 2 jobs since then.

you will either love graphics or hate it after its all said and done. the work can be a little demanding at times. conrey is the best prof. i have ever had. he knows everything about the subject and is willing to answer any and all questions.
Great professor. Definately better than anyone else who teaches graphics.
Great teacher, I learned a lot in his class. He was tough, but I worked hard and got an A

Best Professor ever. He is so clear on what he says, but if you miss or don't understand he is very willing to help you. VERY FUNNY. His class is hard, but if you just work at it you will do fine. Take him for 1211 and 1212. He expects you to know a good bit from 1211 so makes sure to pay attention the first time. Other prof. don't explain as much.
Very good professor. Learned to use SolidWorks very well and do hand drawings very well from his graphics I and II classes.
The guy is a great Professor. If you don't learn something or get a bad grade. It is because you didn't go to class or do your work on time.
Great professor. Very reasonable and helpful.  The only professor to take engineering graphics from.
Good pace, challenging, You actually learn!!!

GREATEST PROFESSOR EVER!!! His all nighters of work is fun and yet hard. Really really helpful, and crystal clear. Its hard not to pay attention. In Graphics he is a GOD! He'll teach you all the way to make graphics design extremely easy. BE PREPARED TO WORK AND DON'T MISS CLASS.. AT ALL!!
Great, he really wants his students to do well

Awesome teacher! Best one to take for EDG hands down. I took EDG 1 with him this past semester, and I plan to take EDG 2 with him because I'm positive he'll be a great teacher. He knows what he's talking about, and knows how to teach well.

The absolute best at his job. I took him for  graphics 1and2 and got an A in both. A teacher first and active in industry. Knows graphics very well. He loves democrats, architects and dumb questions. I recommend this professor 100%.

This Teacher is Very Difficult, and Has inconsistent grading. But he is a must for this class. He is by far the best professor in the subject, and knows what he is doing. Your boss will thank you for taking his class.
VERY GOOD PROFESSOR!! will answer any question even if you are not in his class. Loves what he does and it shows in the way he teaches. highly recommened!!

Great teacher! Knows EVERYTHING about microstation! If you ask him for help, he will always give you a good and clear answer. Very understanding but NEVER MISS CLASS or you will fall behind. You'll learn tons from Conrey- I wish all SPSU teachers were as awesome as him. TAKE HIM!
Highly recommended.  You and your future boss will thank you for taking his class.

One of the best teachers I ever had, was very quick to answer questions. He cares about subject matter and holds his students to a high standard, not in an obnoxious way. Class moral as a result of this is the highest I've seen.

Conrey is by far one of if not the most helpful professors I have ever dealt with. You have a problem with anything go to him. Also, he is one hell of a teacher. If you dont understand it he will find a way to make sure you do.
Not really a hard class, but he does teach at a fast pace.
AMAZING, kind, caring, and every other good adjective.  Take him instead of Flemming if you want to make a high grade and actually understand what the heck is going on, but expect to work.
He is a great teacher and even recommends you rate him. I would tell anyone to take his courses. Very helpful guy.

Great guy. Always willing to help and speaks very clearly. IF YOU MISS CLAS YOU WiLL FALL BEHIND. I WOULDN'T recommend taking a day off. If he gives a reading assignment there will almost always be a quiz. If you complain and moan and arent willing to work hard take flemming
The Microstation Expert! Very clear and helpful. He does give pop quizes, so be sure to do the reading assignments. Tests are fair. Final project can be very difficult.

EG1211 is a breeze with him but be prepared to work for EG1212 and whatever you do, DO NOT GET BEHIND. If you miss one class you will miss out on something important and it is almost impossible to catch up. If your not ready to work then take Fleming.

he is a great teacher, he knows microstation like the back of his hand. he gives a lot of drawings but there not hard to do, if you just pay attention in class. he gives a midterm and a final, but they arent that difficult...just time consuming. if you want an easy B take him.
You got to know some basics about drafting if you want to do well in this class. Will help you when you need it.
Talks slow and clear. He is willing to repeat instructions as many times as it takes. He is very knowledgeable about Microstation. Overall, he is a great professor; he wants his students to do well.
He's awesome...very helpful. Lets a lot of things slide. Don't get on bad side though! He loves and I mean LOVES Microstation!(Better than you know what he says!)
